N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 7-3.2 - Application

State Regulations
(a) The requirements of this Subpart shall apply to a campground where five or more campsites are occupied or maintained for occupancy except: (1)
those portions of a campground occupied by the owner(s) or operator(s) thereof, or their immediate family; and
(2)
a campground occupied for less than 60 hours in any calendar year. (b) The requirements of this Subpart shall not apply to: (1)
a children's camp as defined in Subpart 7-2 of this Part, migrant farm worker housing as defined in Part 15 of this Title, or a mobile home park as defined in Part 17 of this Title; and
(2)
any other type of operation, occupancy or use of a property determined by the State Commissioner of Health as not being within the intent of regulation by this Subpart. (c) The requirements in this Subpart supercede the provisions in Subpart 7-1 of this Part for travel vehicle parks and campsite operators. Notes
